p: Elevated concentrations of atmospheric CO 2 warm the Earth, reducing the proportion of days below freezing on the breeding grounds (i.e., increased temperature; Lemmen, Warren, Lacroix, & Bush, 2008) and increasing precipitation on the northern U.S. Great Plains during autumn (Melillo, Richmond, & Yohe, 2014). Given these relationships, we substituted the amount of atmospheric CO 2 for these variables to evaluate the potential effects of CO 2 concentration on recruitment.
